intro: Delosperma hollandii, commonly known as the silver frost or white ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces vibrant pink to red flowers in late summer, adding visual interest to its compact form. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a valuable addition to arid landscapes.
